# delay

**Instance Property**

An amount of time that lapses before the animation plays.

## Declaration

```swift
var delay: TimeInterval { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value is `0`, which indicates that the animation plays with no delay. If you set a value for this property, the animation plays from its start time after the specified delay lapses.

During the delayed time, the animation doesn’t update. However, to fill the delayed time with some portion of animation, set a negative [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimStart] instead and choose a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/fillMode] that displays the desired portion of animation.

## Timing the animation

- **speed**: A factor that increases or decreases the animation’s rate of playback.
- **duration**: The total playback time of the animation.
- **offset**: The time, in seconds, at which the animation begins within the duration.
- **trimDuration**: An optional duration that overrides the calculated duration.
- **trimStart**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation plays.
- **trimEnd**: The time, in seconds, at which the source animation stops.
